questions.question: She put the bag next to ...............................
questions.description: Reflexive pronouns are not used after prepositions of place.

questions.question: I helped ............................ to another drink.
questions.description: Help myself is a standard expression.

questions.question: He cut ............................. while shaving.
questions.description: When the subject and the object refer to the same person, the reflexive pronoun is used.

questions.question: The manager ........................... told me this.
questions.description: The reflexive pronoun is often used for emphasis and then it is called the emphatic pronoun.

questions.question: She looked quite pleased with ...............................
questions.description: The reflexive is used in the expression 'be pleased with'.

questions.question: I ............................ decorated the room.
questions.description: The emphatic pronoun is used for emphasis.

questions.question: We enjoyed .............................. while we went camping last week.
She killed ............................... with a knife.
questions.description: When the subject and object refer to the same person, the reflexive is used.

questions.question: The Prime Minister ............................... answered the phone.
questions.description: The emphatic is used for emphasis.

questions.question: Although I don't speak English well, I can make ............................ understood.
questions.description: The reflexive is used in the expression 'make yourself  understood'.
